snippet: A new study paints a broad and detailed picture of immigrant entrepreneurship, affirming the centrality of immigration in the American economy.
abstract: Editorial observes that a new study done by the Fiscal Policy Institute has found that immigrants are more likely to own small-businesses than the rest of the American population; contends that the study affirms the centrality of immigration in the American economy, and Republicans across the country would do well to soften their harsh anti-immigration stance given their rhetoric about small businesses.
lead_paragraph: A new study paints a broad and detailed picture of immigrant entrepreneurship, affirming the centrality of immigration in the American economy.
